bugs.title: CVE-2024-33427 squid: buffer overread leading to denial of service [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-33427 squid: buffer overread leading to denial of service [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-33427 squid: buffer overread leading to denial of service

long_desc.thetext:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Squid version before v.6.10 allows a local attacker cause a denial of service via a improper check of string in function ConfigParser::UnQuote.

Reference:
https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/pull/1763

Created clustal-omega tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283383]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283384]


Created squid tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283382]

This CVE has been rejected because it was not considered a security vulnerability.

References:
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-33427
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-33427

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2283380

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2283380,2283382

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2024-37894 squid: Out-of-bounds write error may lead to Denial of Service [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-37894 squid: Out-of-bounds write error may lead to Denial of Service [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-37894 squid: Out-of-bounds write error may lead to Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
Squid is a caching proxy for the Web supporting HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more. Due to an Out-of-bounds Write error when assigning ESI variables, Squid is susceptible to a Memory Corruption error. This error can lead to a Denial of Service attack.

References:
https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/security/advisories/GHSA-wgvf-q977-9xjg
https://megamansec.github.io/Squid-Security-Audit/esi-underflow.html

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/commit/f411fe7d75197852f0e5ee85027a06d58dd8df4c.patch

Created clustal-omega tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2294355]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2294356]


Created squid tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2294354]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2294353

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
